Question
========

A record was kept of how many cigarettes from 60 individuals for one month they smoke (rounded) daily. The results are shown in the frequency table

  ------------ ---- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- -------- Cigarettes 0 1 2 3 4 5 7 10 12 15 20 30 Total Frequency 36 4 3 3 4 2 1 2 1 2 1 1 1 60 ------------ ---- --- --- --- --- --- --- ---- ---- ---- ---- ---- --------

If we draw 2 individuals from this group (with reversal) then the probability that at least one of them is a smoker (i.e., on average smokes 1 or more cigarettes per day) is equal to

Answerlist
----------

* 0.16
* 0.36
* 0.48
* 0.64

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* 0.16: Incorrect
* 0.36: Incorrect
* 0.48: Incorrect
* 0.64: Correct
